simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function starts an ATS by finding the first ATS command.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Where to start in the ATS

detaileddescription.para: Returns TRUE if the ATS was started
Returns FALSE if the ATS was NOT started

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function starts an ATS on the ATP. This routine does not actually execute any commands, it simply sets up all of the data structures to indicate that the specified ATS is now running. This function also does all of the parameter checking.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: a CFE_SB_MsgPtr_t pointer that references a software bus message

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine stops an ATS from executing on the ATP. This routine will execute even if an ATS is not currently executing in the buffer.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: a CFE_SB_MsgPtr_t pointer that references a software bus message

briefdescription.para: Stops an ATS & clears out data.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This is a generic routine that is used to clear out the ATP information to stop an ATS.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function initiates an ATS switch. An ATS switch cannot be immediatly started when the command is received because of the risk of sending out duplicate commands in the new buffer. (if buffer A has executed 3 of the 5 commands for second N, and the switch command is recvd at second N, the switch would happen in the same second, causing buffer B to execute all 5 commands in second N , assuming that the buffers had an overlap of duplicate commands.)

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: a CFE_SB_MsgPtr_t pointer that references a software bus message

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine is called when the ATS IN-LINE request SWITCH ATS is encountered. This routine stops the current ATS from executing and starts the 'other' one. It is assumed that there is an ATS running because this command is only valid as an IN-LINE ATS request.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: Returns TRUE if the switch was successful
Returns FALSE if the switch was NOT successful

briefdescription.para: Switches ATS's at a safe time.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function does the ATS switch when it is determined that the switch is "safe". When the switch request was made, the switch pend flag was set. After every scheduling of the SCP, the switch pend flag is checked. If the switch pend flag is set, this routine is called. This routine checks to see that the current time is one second past the time to start the new ATS. If it is the correct time, then the switch is performed. All of this has the effect of creating a syncronized switch of the ATS buffers, assuring that no duplicate commands are sent.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

briefdescription.para: Jump time in an ATS Command.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command is used to jump to a specified time in the currently running ATS. The jump command will effectively restart the ATS at the time given in the command. Because there is no restriction on the time given in the command, the ATP may try to restart the ATS at any time before or after the current time. In the case of the time tag being before the current time, ( a backwards jump ) the ATP will simply skip the commands that have been executed ( or failed execution ) and end up at the same location as before. In the case of the jump time being after the current time, the ATP will skip all commands with time tags less than the jump time and start executing the ATS at the time equal to the jump time. If there are no commands with time tags equal to the jump time, the ATP will set up the ATS to wait for the first command after the jump time. When a command is skipped while doing the jump, the command's status is marked as SKIPPED unless it has already been marked as EXECUTED, FAILED_DISTRIBUTION, or FAILED_CHECKSUM.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: a CFE_SB_MsgPtr_t pointer that references a software bus message

briefdescription.para: Lets an ATS continue if a command failed the checksum.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sets whether or not to let an ATS continue when one of the commands in the ATS fails a checksum validation

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: a CFE_SB_MsgPtr_t pointer that references a software bus message

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function adds the contents of the Append ATS table to the selected ATS. The ATS is then re-sorted for command execution order. This command may target an ATS that is currently active (executing). This command will not change the ATS execution state.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: a CFE_SB_MsgPtr_t pointer that references a software bus message
